title: MEAS MAT_SCI 452-0-20 Selected Topics in the Solid State

descriptions.name: Overview of class
descriptions.value: This course will present an intermediate treatment of the optical properties of semiconductors and insulators. Topics to be discussed include: absorption and dispersion, radiative transitions, non-radiative recombination, stimulated emission, photoelectric and photovoltaic effects, semiconductor heterostructures and their properties, non-linear optical material properties and waveguides, and photonic crystals.

descriptions.name: Registration Requirements
descriptions.value: Mat Sci 405 or permission of instructor.

descriptions.name: Teaching Method
descriptions.value: The course will involve three hours of lectures per week.

descriptions.name: Evaluation Method
descriptions.value: There will be two hourly exams and a term paper.

descriptions.name: Class Materials (Required)
descriptions.value: Optical Processes in Semiconductors, J.I. Pankove. 2nd edition. (Dover 2010) ISBN: 9780486602752

descriptions.name: Class Materials (Suggested)
descriptions.value: Introduction to Semiconductor Optics, N. Peyghambarian, S. W. Koch, and A. Mysyrowicz (Prentice Hall 1993).
